translated: I have gone down the wrong path,
deluded by what should be avoided.”
skillful and well-considered,🔽by which one should not dispel
in the world, powerful and strong;
so you are considered by us.”
the sage who delights in the qualities of the Dhamma;
“This passion has arisen in your body,
Abandon it, may it be well with you,
you are considered by many to be wise.”

analyzed: te andhakārake kāme  bahu dukkhe mahā vise
translated: “Those who are in the dark of sensual pleasures,🔽In the midst of much suffering and great danger,
I will seek out their root,
And cut off passion with all its bonds.”
Having spoken thus, the sage Hārita,
Who was devoted to the truth,
The Hārita Jātaka is the fifth.
